meanings.definition: People who engage in dishonest or fraudulent behavior, especially in order to obtain money or goods illegally.
meanings.sent1: The blaggers were caught trying to steal from the store.
meanings.sent2: The police are investigating a group of blaggers for their illegal activities.
meanings.sent3: The blaggers tried to trick the cashier into giving them free items.
meanings.sent4: The blaggers' schemes were like a tangled web of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blaggers sneaking around in the dark stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone in order to obtain something dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: She blaggers her way into getting discounts at the store.
meanings.sent2: He blaggers his friends into lending him money all the time.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to blaggers their teacher into giving them extra recess.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talking blaggers his way out of trouble every time.
meanings.sent5: The con artist blaggers his victims with false promises and lies.
